summary: According to the District Energy and Environment Unit (DEEU), with the help of 51 KW electricity produced by Pipalbotkhola, Jharban-gkhola, and Putalibaskhola mini-hydropower projects, the residents of Khara are enjoying unlimited electricity supply. Pradip Shrestha of DEEU said that in the last two years mini and pico-hydropower projects, with a combined output of 587 KW electricity, have lit 5,643 households in the district. Moreover, he said preparations are underway to generate 449 KW electricity through various mini-hydropower projects to electrify more than 49 villages in the running fiscal year. Local Development Officer Bharat Kumar Sharma said that they have prioritised the development of electricity and transport services in the first phase of development of  Rukum .
title: remote-rukum-villages-get-electricity
